required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Neonatal Hypotonia Associated With in Utero Exposure to Antidepressant
clinical_study.official_title: Neonatal Hypotonia Associated With in Utero Exposure to Antidepressant-Analysis of Two Pharmacovigilance Databases

brief_summary.textblock: To better characterize the neonatal hypotonia associated with in utero exposure to antidepressants, so far limited to clinical cases, we will perform an observational retrospective pharmacovigilance study, using two databases. First, disproportionality analysis in VigibaseÂ®, the World Health Organization global database, will be perform between antidepressant drugs and neonatal hypotonia . Second, narratives from the French National Pharmacovigilance Database will be extracted.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Case reported in the World Health Organization (WHO) pharmacovigilance database to April 1st 2021
primary_outcome.description: Identification and extractions of cases of neonatal hypotonia newborns following in utero exposure to antidepressant drugs

intervention.description: Cases reported in the World Health Organization (WHO) and the French pharmacovigilance database of neonatal hypotonia newborns following in utero exposure to antidepressant drugs, with a chronology compatible with the drug toxicity
intervention.other_name: in utero exposure to antidepressant drugs

study_pop.textblock: all neonatal hypotonia newborns cases associated with in utero exposure to antidepressant drugs retrived in the two pharmacovigilance database

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- neonatal hypotonia newborns cases associated with in utero exposure to antidepressant drugs
Exclusion Criteria:
- Reports with maternal suicide, congenital malformation and hypotonia occurring only during breastfeeding

condition_browse.mesh_term: Drug-Related Side Effects and Adverse Reactions
